title: serials short play series
description: Five teams of actors perform five original, 10-minute episodic plays, each with only six hours of rehearsal time. Then it’s up to you, the audience, to vote for your favorites, which will return for a new installment of the same storyline the following week.

title: love positive women 2025
description: Visual Aids, the Fire Island Artist Residency, Positive Women’s Network, The Well Project, and Dieu Donné present their annual exhibition of handmade paper valentines created by artists, activists, and HIV-positive women.
address: first floor hallway of moma ps1 (lic)
cost: Free admission for New York state residents ($5-10 otherwise)

title: circles of abstraction opening
description: The Bust Gallery presents an evening of art, performance, and music for its latest pop-up. Featuring art by Sasha Bianca, Miriam Portilla Espino, Callen Schaub, Iutian Tsai, and Annika Rhea, Circles of Abstraction includes DJs and live performance painting by Rhea.

title: syme’s letter writer: letter writing workshop with rachel syme
description: Rachel Syme, writer and creator of Penpalooza, launches her new book—a guide to the lost art of letter writing—with a reading and letter-writing workshop at Strand Bookstore’s rare book room.

title: landline comedy at wild east brewing co.
description: Get hoppy at the barrel cellar at Wild East Brewing Co., which is hosting a stand-up comedy show featuring sets by Gastor Almonte, Isabel Hagen, Sara Hennessey, Carrie Ross, Dan Treadway, and Ted Jones.

title: top shelf stories
description: Julia Whitehouse serves up an evening of storytelling at UCB, with guests Robin Gelfenbien, Rob Penty, Britt Genelin, and Mark Pagán, plus one open mic slot reserved for an audience member.

title: golden spiral comedy show
description: At Mindy Raf and Katie Compa’s Golden Spiral Comedy Show, stand-up set lengths follow the Fibonacci sequence. Tonight’s show includes guests Talib Babb, Steven Rogers, Hari Kondabolu, and Luz Michelle.

title: 13 ways to celebrate lunar new year in nyc
description: Welcome the new year at celebrations across the city: a firecracker ceremony, lion dance performances, parties, family-friendly activities, and more.

title: the cashmere sale
description: Cozy up to cool deals at clothingline’s annual cashmere sale. Snag sweaters, pants, wraps, hats, gloves, scarves, and more at prices starting at $30.

title: get lit! richard price and lakecia benjamin
description: Novelist and screenwriter Richard Price joins WNYC’s All of It host Alison Stewart for a discussion about his new novel, Lazarus Man. The conversation will be followed by a musical performance from Grammy-nominated saxophonist Lakecia Benjamin.

title: miller theater’s pop-up concert series
description: The Columbia University School of the Arts’s musical happy hour returns for a new season of hour-long concerts where the audience is permitted to sit onstage with the performers and enjoy a free drink. Tonight, saxophonist and composer Ole Mathisen performs his latest project Vector Series with collaborators Craig Taborn, François Moutin, and Dan Weiss.

title: we love a theme: a storytelling show
description: A lineup of performers tell funny, heartwarming, and cringe-inducing tales at tonight’s ‘starting over’ edition of Bailey Swilley’s monthly storytelling show. Featuring Ian Goldstein, Ali Levin, Vernon Payne, and Seaton Smith.

title: the lavender scare
description: Gabe González presents an irreverent LGBTQ+ comedy variety show featuring stand-up and interactive trivia games about LGBTQ+ history. Tonight's guest performers: Dylan Adler, Ái Vy Luu, and Jacke Cornell.

title: live band karaoke at arlene’s grocery
description: Choose from a wide assortment of rock and pop songs and sing with your very own live band backing you up at Arlene’s Grocery (LES). Led by Leslie Goshko, and featuring Lucas Shine, Matthew Lindsey, and Alan Camlet.

title: tickets go on sale for christo and jeanne-claude: the gates and unrealized projects for new york city
description: The Shed presents an immersive exhibition marking the 20th anniversary of Christo and Jeanne-Claude’s landmark Central Park public art project, The Gates. Running 2/12-3/23, the exhibition will include original drawings, scale models, and elements from The Gates and unrealized projects, presented alongside immersive imagery and multimedia.

title: we have fun: a stand-up show
description: Hosts Zach Sims and Dan Wilbur bring the fun-ny to Young Ethel’s, with stand-up by guests Rob Cantrell, Lizzy Cassidy, Patrick Hastie, and Joe Pontillo.

title: that show with chris gethard
description: Comedian and writer Chris Gethard launches a new variety show at UCB, featuring a live band and experimental sets from both seasoned comedy vets and up-and-coming performers.
